1.content: It's a new summer, and Camp Mystique is full of Campers and Counselors waiting for some summer fun! What kind of character do you want to follow? Or do you want to jump into a different scenario? Maybe a field trip to the beach or a classroom at summer school?
1.title: Welcome to Camp!

11.content: The boys are all in their respective cabins right now. It's almost morning, and almost time for someone to change. Who will that be?
11.title: Boys

choices: Daniel takes a swim at the lake but begins to grow while doing so.
Daniel steps outside but when he comes back, all the other boys have shrunk.
Daniel begins to feel the ground shaking and wakes the other boys up.
111.content:
Daniel's eyes bolt open, the sunlight pouring in through the curtain-less windows interrupting his sleep and forcing him awake. He didn't mind though; he rarely got more than six hours of sleep at home, and with all the excitement and activities going on at camp, he expected to get even less here. That, after all, was how memories would be made, right?

He sits up and throws the blanket off of his body, looking around the room of Cabin 14, swinging his legs over the side of the top bunk bed he had been sleeping on. By the looks of it, the four other boys in the cabin appear to still all be asleep. Below him is Zack, the youngest in the cabin at age 12, who nevertheless was a few inches taller than Daniel at 5'3". He seemed to be the shyest in the group, with dirty blonde hair that covered his eyes and which he seemed to hide behind often. Daniel didn't exactly blame him; after all, he probably behaved the same way during his first year of camp - which was only a year ago, a fact that Daniel had a hard time believing. However, the previous night at supper, Zack seemed to open up with the group, and Daniel had realized that the boy was exceedingly smart, having some great ideas to improve the go-kart they were constructing for the big race next week. He was definitely going to be a good addition to the group.

Across the cabin, Adam sleeps on the top bunk. He's older than Daniel by only a day, but seems to be opposite in every other way, at least physically speaking. Already almost six feet tall and still growing, Adam also has a nicely develop set of muscles, and could easily pass for a sixteen or seventeen year old, if not for his clean-shaven, boyish face. His auburn-colored hair was even longer than Zack's, seemingly not having been cut in nearly two years. Despite their physical differences, Daniel and Adam were the closest among the group, Adam taking Daniel under his wing and making sure to protect him when needed, and Daniel being there for Adam and supporting him emotionally, especially when his grandmother suddenly died during the middle of camp last year. Daniel couldn't deny that he thought about Adam in a more-than-platonic fashion, but he could only hope and dream that his friend felt the same way.

In the bed underneath Adam is Miguel. One of the few minorities at camp, Miguel seemed to get picked on more than usual by the few bullies that were present at the camp, but he always let it slide in good-natured fashion, running his hands through his medium-length, dark hair and relieving the situation with humor. At 14, he's the oldest camper in the cabin (not counting the counselor), but like Daniel this was only his second year. The boys of Cabin 14 accepted him like family, and he often remarked that he felt more at home here than back with his family.

The last boy, the one snoring on the full-sized bed at the back of the cabin, is Josh, the 17-year-old camp counselor. Josh was actually the son of the owners of the camp, and had basically lived here since he was a baby. When Daniel first heard this, he thought Josh would be stuck-up, snooty, or strict, but Josh was actually the coolest of all the counselors (at least, that was the opinion of all the boys of Cabin 14). He would take the boys on special "Cabin-14 Only nature hikes", showing them parts of the woods that the other campers never saw. He'd also share with them cool secrets about the camp, even once taking the group into the old abandoned service tunnels that ran underneath the camp. The only thing slightly off about Josh was how he would look at some of the boys a little too long, especially Daniel (at least, that's what Daniel perceived). It was certainly strange behavior, and Daniel had a feeling that Josh might be wanting something more than friendship with him or the other boys of the cabin, but so far he had not made any moves. As he thought about it some more over time, however, Daniel couldn't decide if those moves would be entirely unwelcome. He considered Josh attractive enough, if a little nerdy, with a very skinny, lanky frame - almost six and a half feet tall but weighing less than a hundred and sixty pounds. His most attractive feature, though, had to be his eyes, which hid behind large, thick-framed glasses, and his light-brown hair would vary in length, sometimes being almost a crew-cut, and sometimes having grown out so much that it would completely cover his eyes.

Yup, Daniel decides as he quietly climbs off the top bunk and onto the floor, he was definitely excited to be in this cabin, and couldn't picture being with any other group in the camp. The boys here were quirky, sure, but so was he -- they all fit together like pieces in a puzzle.

That puzzle, however, is about to change, for better or for worse, and in a big, big way.
111.title: Cabin 14

choices: He heads off to find his cabinmates.

1111.content:
Looking at the clock, Daniel realizes he still has plenty of time for his favorite activity: a morning swim. Slipping out of the boxers he had slept in and into his swim trunks, he puts on his flip-flops and quietly makes his way outside, being careful not to wake up the other boys.

The morning air is cool and crisp, and Daniel takes a deep breath, taking it all in, then smiles. Cabin 14 is the closest cabin to the lake, just down the hill from their front door, and it only takes Daniel a minute or so to jog there. No one else is there; the only sound Daniel hears in the entire camp is the soft chirping of early-rising birds.

He dips his toe in the water, expecting it to be cool like all the previous times he had been in this summer, but instead it seems to be surprisingly warm. He examines the water closely; it's as clean and sparkling clear as ever. Shrugging, he wades in, the warmth in the water feeling soothing and very enjoyable. In fact, it's warmth seems to seep into his skin, filling up his entire body with a peculiar yet pleasurable feeling.

He keeps walking in until his entire body is underwater, dipping his head in last. Waiting a few seconds, he tries to get used to the temperature, but it continues to be strange yet pleasing. Shrugging, Daniel starts off swimming, heading towards the island in the middle of the lake.

As he swims, his muscles tingle, burning more than usual. He also feels a strange tightness starting to well up around his legs, his swimming trunks seeming to stretch across his thighs. Though this bothers him for a moment, he shakes it off and continues swimming, not stopping to see that his body is changing and getting bigger as he does so.

By the time he makes it to the island on the other side, the fabric can't take it any more and loudly rips apart. Daniel reaches down and grabs his trunks before they float away, standing up in the water on the shallow end by the beach. Something is definitely strange here. He had been in this part of the lake just yesterday with his cabinmates, and he remembered the water here coming up to his chest. Now, it only comes up to his knees. Could that much water have evaporated or drained elsewhere, he thinks, failing to associate this with his ripped swim trunks.

He realizes that he's now naked, and decides to try to head back to the cabin as quickly as possible. Taking off for the side of the lake that he came from, Daniel's muscles again tingle as he swims, and he feels a weird swelling sensation all over. By the time he's halfway across, his toes, knees, and fingers are scraping across the bottom of the lake. That can't be, he thinks, the lake should be nearly ten feet deep here. He stops, standing up in the water, which now barely covers his ankles. He looks down and sees the roofs of the cabins of his camp, and the tops of the trees near them. It is only now that he realizes what has happened: somehow, some way, he's grown to be a giant, over fifty feet tall.
1111.title: A Morning Swim

113.content:
The mess hall's line was long as Sean waited for his food. It was a stereotypical day as the lunch lady was serving "mystery meat". Sean and everyone else of course, didn't want to eat it, but it was the only food in the entire camp.

Sean got his gross, sloppy, slightly green, mystery meat and went to sit down with his campers. They all inched closer to their counselor as he sat down.
"Hi Sean!" Johnny said, a short, white, big blue eyed, black haired, ten year old kid. Johnny was an athletic type, but still incredibly sweet and caring. He cared for all the other campers in his group, as well as his counselor.
"Hey Johnny." Sean said, patting him on the head. Sean then felt pressure on the right side of his body, he turned and saw Jonah, a short, hispanic, black haired 9 year old hugging him Jonah was incredibly affectionate towards all the staff, but was picked on by other campers because of this.
"Hi Jonah." Sean said, jokingly, slowly pushing him off of his shoulder. Then the two twins, Josh and Spencer waved at Sean from across the table. They both had straight blonde hair, white skin, brown eyes, and were ten years old. Sean waved back.

The five ate their dinner and talked over it, enjoying each others company. They joked, talked about activities for the next day, etc. Then Sean started to feel funny.
"I'll be right back." He told the kids as he ran off to the bathroom.

He reached the bathroom and looked at himself in the mirror, his face was red and he was dripping with sweat. "Oh god, I must have food poisoning or something!"

He could feel his shorts rise up a little bit on him, they now ended above his knees. The waistband itself stretched out, and slipped down ever so slightly. The sleeves of his shirt rolled up until they only covered his shoulders, and the bottom of the shirt pulled up to reveal his belly button and happy trail. The glasses he was wearing started to bend, and eventually snapped off his head. To his luck, his vision seemed to have repaired as he no longer needed them. The watch he was wearing on his wrist also snapped off and fell to the floor around his shoes. He looked down and could see that his shoes were being stretched into the shape of his expanding feet. The shoes suddenly gave way, ripping them in half. Taking off his shoes, he found that all ten of his toes and expanded and shot out of his socks, and his socks had fallen from riding above his ankles to barely hanging on to his heel.

But then it all stopped. Sean looked at himself in the mirror, then he moved his hands around and looked at them. HE watched as he wiggled is large toes. And it finally dawned on him. "Oh my God! I just grew!"

11312.content:
Sean was struggling to wrap his head around what had just happened. He stared back down at his body, taking in the remnants of what he had been wearing. His counselor t-shirt that had previously gone down to his waist now only came halfway up his chest, and his loose cargo shorts that went past his knees were now constricting his upper thighs. His shoes, socks, even his glasses had completely given up the fight and were in tatters on the floor.

Sean stepped back, trying to properly look at himself in the mirror. The bathroom was meant for campers shorter than he was, even at normal height, so his head was already towards the top of the mirror. Now, he had to crouch down somewhat to see his reflection; a bit difficult without his glasses. He was drenched in sweat, and now that he had stopped growing, he noticed how flush his face felt. Sean guessed that by how much he had to squat down just to see himself, he had to be nearly seven-and-a-half feet tall now.

Sighing, Sean sat down on the nearby toilet lid and tried to process what had happened, and what he was going to do next. Sean realized he had two options: he could wait here until everyone else left the dining hall, quickly hurry his campers back to their bunks, then try and figure out what happened to him, or he could go back into the dining hall and pretend everything was normal, 'no sir-ee I didn't just grow nearly two feet suddenly that's ridiculous I always wear my clothes like this' or whatever nonsense he'd have to make up.

Realizing that it would be easier to make up something semi-believable for the kids, he opted for the former. Sean picked his watch up from the floor and checked the time; the entire ordeal had only taken 15 minutes, though it felt like hours. Waiting any longer would make the situation worse. Sighing deeply, he stood up, adjusted the remainder of his clothing, and grabbed a scrap of cloth from the floor to clean his face.

Exiting the bathroom, he realized he was right: his campers were the only ones left, having not yet been dismissed. Sean casually walked up to them, smiling slightly and trying to play it cool. "Hey guys! Sorry about that, something must not have sat right with me." He fake-winced, trying to make some kind of reasonable explanation for his sudden and drastic departure. "Don't worry, though," he brightened up, "if anyone else isn't feeling well, I'll take you to the nurse right away!"

Sean paused for a moment to give the boys a chance to say something, hopefully about anything other than his size. After a moment of awkward silence, he spoke up again. "You guys must be tired. Let's head back to the cabin and get some rest for tomorrow's activities."

The counselor moved his hands to adjust his clothes again but quickly decided against it to avoid drawing more attention to the issue. Sean headed to the dining hall doors, his campers following behind him. As they walked, Sean listened in to see if any of them were talking about his abrupt change in stature.
